text: Stephen Ole Marai (born 11 November 1962) is a Kenyan male former middle- distance runner. He was a finalist in the 800 metres at the 1987 World Championships in Athletics and finished sixth despite Tom McKean catching his foot on the last lap.Men's 800m at 1987 World Championships in Rome. Youtube. Retrieved 2018-02-18. His personal best time of 1.44.42 minutes was achieved in 1990 and ranked him sixth in the world that year.Stephen Ole Marai. Track and Field Statistics. Retrieved 2018-02-18. He also competed at the 1987 All- Africa Games in his native Kenya, where he was a silver medallist behind his compatriot and world champion Billy Konchellah .All-Africa Games. GBR Athletics. title: Stephen Ole Marai
